skills.name: Goes Where He Pleases
skills.blurb:
{{sbc|Innate:}} {{ci|Dr. Mundo}} {{sti|health regeneration|regenerates}} an additional portion of {{as|his '''maximum''' health}}.
{{sbc|Passive:}} Periodically, '''Dr. Mundo''' gains immunity to the next hostile spell's {{tip|immobilize|immobilizing}} effects, and upon resisting one, he loses a portion of {{as|his '''current''' health}} and drops a canister nearby.
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Dr. Mundo''' {{stil|health regeneration|regenerates}} an additional{{ft|{{as|2% of his '''maximum''' health}} every 5 seconds.|{{as|{{fd|0.4}}% of his '''maximum''' health}} each second.}}

{{sbc|Passive:}} Periodically, '''Dr. Mundo''' gains immunity to the {{tip|immobilize|immobilizing}} effects of the next hostile immobilizing spell to affect him. Upon resisting one, '''Dr. Mundo''' pays a {{as|health cost}} equal to {{as|7% of his '''current''' health}} and propels a canister that lands 525 units in the general direction of its source, remaining on the ground for 7 seconds.

'''Dr. Mundo''' can move near the canister to consume it, {{tip|heal|healing}} himself for {{as|8% of his '''maximum''' health}} and reducing the {{sti|cooldown}} of ''Goes Where He Pleases'' by 15 seconds. Enemy {{tip|champion|champions}} can move near it to destroy it.
skills.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Dr. Mundo Unknown value: stil / health regeneration / regenerates an additional
Passive: Periodically, Dr. Mundo gains immunity to the immobilizing effects of the next hostile immobilizing spell to affect him. Upon resisting one, Dr. Mundo pays a health cost equal to 7% of his current health and propels a canister that lands 525 units in the general direction of its source, remaining on the ground for 7 seconds.
Dr. Mundo can move near the canister to consume it, healing himself for 8% of his maximum health and reducing the cooldown of Goes Where He Pleases by 15 seconds. Enemy champions can move near it to destroy it.
Goes Where He Pleases' cooldown resets upon respawn.
skills.notes:
* Upon being triggered by a hostile {{tip|immobilize|immobilizing}} effects, ''Goes Where He Pleases'' will also grant '''Dr. Mundo''' immunity to additional immobilizing effects from the same {{tip|cast instance}}.
** Abilities where non-immobilizing effects and damage are nested into immobilizing ones will have them also prevented. Non-immobilizing effects and damage applied separately (the vast majority of cases) are not prevented.
* {{tip|Spell shield}} and {{ai|Black Shield|Morgana}} take priority over ''Goes Where He Pleases''.
* ''Goes Where He Pleases'' will not trigger against nor resist {{cais|R|Rell}} {{tip|kinematics|ongoing kinematic effect}}.
** It will trigger against and prevent the ability's initial {{tip|airborne|displacement}}, but even in that case, not prevent the continous effect.
* ''Goes Where He Pleases'' is special cased to also trigger against the {{tip|slow}} from {{ai|Realm of Death|Mordekaiser}}.
** ''Goes Where He Pleases'' will not resist {{ai|Realm of Death|Mordekaiser}}.{{bug}}

skills.name: Infected Bonesaw
skills.blurb:
{{sbc|Active:}} {{ci|Dr. Mundo}} throws an infected bonesaw in the target direction that deals {{as|magic damage}} and {{tip|slow|slows}} the first enemy hit.
If the bonesaw hits an enemy {{tip|champion}}, '''Dr. Mundo''' {{tip|heals}} for the entire {{as|health cost}}, reduced to half {{as|health cost}} when a non-champion is hit.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Dr. Mundo''' throws an infected bonesaw in the target direction that deals {{as|magic damage}} to the first enemy hit and {{tip|slow|slows}} them by 40% for 2 seconds.
''Infected Bonesaw'' has a minimum damage threshold, and is capped against {{tip|monsters}}.
If the bonesaw hits an enemy {{tip|champion}}, '''Dr. Mundo''' {{tip|heals}} for 100% of the {{as|health cost}}, reduced to 50% if a non-champion is hit.
skills.descriptionHtml:
Active: Dr. Mundo throws an infected bonesaw in the target direction that deals magic damage to the first enemy hit and slows them by 40% for 2 seconds.
Infected Bonesaw has a minimum damage threshold, and is capped against monsters.
If the bonesaw hits an enemy champion, Dr. Mundo heals for 100% of the health cost, reduced to 50% if a non-champion is hit.
skills.notes:
* ''Infected Bonesaw'' will be thrown from where '''Dr. Mundo''' was at the start of the cast time.
* {{pending for test}} {{tip|Spell shield}} blocking the ability's effects on the enemy does not prevent '''Dr. Mundo''' from receiving the health cost refund.

effects.str: • Magic Damage: % of target's current health

• Minimum Damage:
  • Capped Monster Damage:

skills.name: Heart Zapper
skills.blurb:
{{sbc|Active:}} {{ci|Dr. Mundo}} charges up a defibrillator for a few seconds, continually dealing {{as|magic damage}} to nearby enemies and storing a portion of the post-mitigation damage he takes.
''Heart Zapper'' can be recast within the duration, and does so automatically after the duration.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Dr. Mundo''' charges up a defibrillator for 4 seconds, dealing {{as|magic damage}} every {{fd|0.25}} seconds to nearby enemies and storing a portion of the {{tt|post-mitigation|Damage calculated after modifiers}} damage he takes.
''Heart Zapper'' can be recast after 1 second within the duration, and does so automatically after the duration.

{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Dr. Mundo''' detonates the defibrillator, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to nearby enemies. If at least one enemy {{tip|champion}} or large {{tip|monster}} is hit, he {{tip|heal|heals}} for 100% of all the damage stored, reduced to 50% otherwise.
skills.descriptionHtml:
Active: Dr. Mundo charges up a defibrillator for 4 seconds, dealing magic damage every 0.25 seconds to nearby enemies and storing a portion of the post-mitigation damage he takes.
Heart Zapper can be recast after 1 second within the duration, and does so automatically after the duration.
Recast: Dr. Mundo detonates the defibrillator, dealing magic damage to nearby enemies. If at least one enemy champion or large monster is hit, he heals for 100% of all the damage stored, reduced to 50% otherwise.
leveling:
{{st|Magic Damage per Tick|{{ap|5 to 20}}|Total Magic Damage|{{ap|5*16 to 20*16}}}}
{{st|Damage Stored|{{ap|25 to 45}}% of damage taken}}
skills.notes:
* The charge up applies {{tip|persistent area damage}} and the detonation deals {{tip|area damage}}.
* {{tip|Spell shield}} will only block the detonation.
* ''Heart Zapper'' will occasionally deal an additional tick of damage.{{bug}}
* ''Heart Zapper'' and its recast will buffer and cast at the end of {{ais|Infected Bonesaw|Dr. Mundo}} cast time if attempted to cast during it.
** As with all buffering of this type, another input such as a movement command can override the buffering of the spell again.

  • Damage Stored: % of damage taken

skills.name: Blunt Force Trauma
skills.range: {{tt|800|Corpse push distance, from Dr. Mundo's center}}
skills.blurb:
{{sbc|Passive:}} {{ci|Dr. Mundo}} gains {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' attack damage}}}}, plus an additional amount based on {{as|his '''missing''' health}}.
{{sbc|Active:}} '''Dr. Mundo's''' next basic attack deals {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}}, increased based on {{as|his '''missing''' health}}. If the target dies, their corpse is sent flying away in a line, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to enemies it passes through.
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Dr. Mundo''' gains {{as|'''bonus''' attack damage}}, plus an additional amount based on his {{as|'''missing''' health}}, reaching maximum value at {{as|70% '''missing''' health}}.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Dr. Mundo's''' next basic attack within 4 seconds is empowered to have an {{tip|uncancelable windup}}, gain {{sti|50 '''bonus''' range}}, and deal {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}}, increased by {{pp|key=%|key1=%|type='''missing''' health|0 to 60 for 11|0 to 40|color=health|formula=1.5% per 1% of '''missing''' health, capped at 40% '''missing''' health}}. If the target dies, their corpse is sent flying away in a line, causing all enemies it passes through to take {{as|100% AD}} plus ''Blunt Force Trauma's'' minimum '''bonus''' damage.
''Blunt Force Trauma'' as well as the triggering {{as|attack's damage}} is increased to 140% against {{tip|minions}} and non-epic {{tip|monsters}}.
''Blunt Force Trauma'' {{tip|basic attack reset|resets}} '''Dr. Mundo's''' basic attack timer.
skills.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Dr. Mundo gains bonus attack damage, plus an additional amount based on his missing health, reaching maximum value at 70% missing health.
Active: Dr. Mundo's next basic attack within 4 seconds is empowered to have an uncancelable windup, gain 50 bonus range, and deal bonus physical damage, increased by 0 to 40 ‒ undefined. If the target dies, their corpse is sent flying away in a line, causing all enemies it passes through to take 100% AD plus Blunt Force Trauma's minimum bonus damage.
Blunt Force Trauma as well as the triggering attack's damage is increased to 140% against minions and non-epic monsters.
Blunt Force Trauma resets Dr. Mundo's basic attack timer.
leveling:
{{st|Bonus AD|{{ap|15 to 35}}}}
{{st|Maximum Additional Bonus AD|{{ap|25 to 45}}|Maximum Total Bonus AD|{{ap|15+25 to 35+45}}}}
{{st|Minimum Bonus Physical Damage|{{ap|5 to 45}} {{as|(+ 7% '''bonus''' health)}}|Maximum Bonus Physical Damage|{{ap|5*1.6 to 45*1.6}} {{as|(+ {{ap|7*1.6}}% '''bonus''' health)}}}}

{{st|Minimum Non-Champion Bonus Damage|{{ap|5*1.4 to 45*1.4}} {{as|(+ {{ap|7*1.4}}% '''bonus''' health)}}|Maximum Non-Champion Bonus Damage|{{ap|5*1.6*1.4 to 45*1.6*1.4}} {{as|(+ {{ap|7*1.6*1.4}}% '''bonus''' health)}}}}
skills.notes:
* ''Blunt Force Trauma's'' attack deals {{tip|basic damage}}, while the target's body being shoved deals {{tip|area damage}} to enemies it passes through.
* ''Blunt Force Trauma's'' attack works against [[structures]], consuming the buff and dealing its full damage.
* ''Blunt Force Trauma'' cannot knock back {{tip|wards}}, [[structures]] or epic {{tip|monsters}} it kills, nor champions that enter a {{tip|zombie state}} upon dying.
* The damage of the enemy's corpse colliding with enemies does not benefit from ''Blunt Force Trauma's'' attack {{tip|critical strike|critically striking}}.

skills.name: Maximum Dosage
skills.blurb:
{{sbc|Active:}} {{ci|Dr. Mundo}} injects himself with chemicals, {{tip|heal|healing}} a portion of {{as|his '''missing''' health}}.
For some time, he gains {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' attack damage}}}} and {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}}, in addition to {{sti|health regeneration|regenerating}} {{as|health}} over the duration.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Dr. Mundo''' injects himself with chemicals, {{tip|heal|healing}} for {{as|20% of his '''missing''' health}}.

For the next 10 seconds, he gains {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' attack damage}}}} and {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}}, in addition to {{sti|health regeneration|regenerating}} {{as|health}} over the duration.
skills.descriptionHtml:
Active: Dr. Mundo injects himself with chemicals, healing for 20% of his missing health.
For the next 10 seconds, he gains bonus attack damage and bonus movement speed, in addition to regenerating health over the duration.
skills.notes:
* The health regeneration granted by ''Maximum Dosage'' adjusts dynamically to '''Dr. Mundo's''' {{as|'''maximum''' health}}.
* ''Maximum Dosage'' will end prematurely upon entering {{tip|resurrection}}.
* {{pending for test}} ''Maximum Dosage'' continuous effect is not affected by {{ri|Revitalize}} as it is [[health regeneration]].
** The immediate heal does benefit from {{ri|Revitalize}}.
* Apart from visually expanding '''Dr. Mundo's''' body, ''Maximum Dosage'' does '''not''' grant increased [[size]].

effects.str:
• Total Health Regeneration: % maximum health
  • Regeneration per Second: % maximum health
  • Bonus Attack Damage: % bonus health
  • Bonus Movement Speed: %
